author: Jett_Pyre
title: A good Spider-Man set for 2020
review:
It's nice seeing more Spider-Man sets being released by Lego. It's interesting to see mech style builds in the Marvel line since the not so good buildable figures from 2012. I like seeing small size minifig scale mechs and at a good price too. Sets like these are affordable ways of getting "desirable" minifigs without shelling out lots of money for just one set. I hope to see more if Lego can still have the Marvel licence.

Pros.

A lot of useful pieces.

There's some good possibility with the mech itself.

There's lots of articulated parts.

Cons.

The Spider-Man minifig is the same one that has been released in 2 other sets from 2019 and the other ones that are available in other sets released in 2020 have dual moulded legs.

The stickered pieces should've been printed.

The ball joint pieces really need to start being printed in other colors, besides light grey.

 

Overall, I think this is a good Marvel set at the price of $10 and I do think you should buy it now at full price.

author: Puidwen
title: Surprisingly hard to assemble
review: Okay open the box and got four bags, and a small set of stickers.  I was thinking of this as "a little kid set" so i was surprised to see the bags contained mostly very small parts.  For some reason the bags containing the parts felt a little slimy this time.  When assembling i kept finding out that i had skip steps or put something on backwards.  But that was probably just me, still if you hand it off to a kid you might want to help him.  That said even with me messing up it was a very easy assembly.  The stickers were nice for being big sticker that went on big parts.  The glue was good enough to hold them, but weak enough to let me take them off when i had mess them up.  For what it is the mecha looks pretty good.  Some nice prints and stickers, bright colors, and it looks like a mecha.  The minifig, for the mostly fits snugly inside the cockpit.  He has a little play but i don't think he's coming out of it accidentally.  The mecha seems very poseable.  And it will stand up on it's own.  As to the minifig it's just a spiderman minifig.  I will say i thought his head could use some darker web-lines.  He seems to have trouble holding the bigger web line. I suspect how much you enjoy this set depends on who you are.  If your the type to enjoy very complex sets stay away.  However i would glady gift it to a kid who love both lego and spiderman.  It seems to run about $10 online (mine was a gift) which seems about right about it.
